poem:
### Shadows on Sand

in Gaza's shadowed breath  
convoys break against  
the call of desperation—  
history's harsh whispers  
clash steel upon sand

aid unlaced by greedy fingers  
fables written in silence  
echo Jean-Pierre's eyes—  
truth a fragile dance  
along the border's edge
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Convincing evidence Israel backed aid convoy looters in Gaza, historian says A historian who spent more than a month in Gaza at the turn of the year says he saw “utterly convincing” evidence that Israel supported looters who attacked aid convoys during the conflict. Jean-Pierre Filiu, a professor of Middle East studies at France’s prestigious Sciences Po university, entered Gaza in December where he was hosted by an international humanitarian organisation in the southern coastal". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
